summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, commanding an unnamed recipient to appear before the grand jury on August 20, 2019, and to produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein. The subpoena is dated August 15, 2019, and signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: He is the United States Attorney who signed and issued the grand jury subpoena.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands the production of all materials relating to him, indicating he is the central subject of the grand jury investigation.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to gather evidence for a grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance
events.description: The unnamed recipient of the subpoena is commanded to appear before the grand jury to testify and produce evidence.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 15, 2019, for an appearance on August 20, 2019, indicating active federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein after his 2019 arrest.
The subpoena demands production of 'All materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein,' including text messages, emails, social media, documents, and notes, showing a broad evidence-gathering scope.
The subpoena is signed by U.S. Attorney Geoffrey S. Berman, confirming the Southern District of New York's lead role in the investigation.
The subpoena includes a rider with legal advice on rights and instructions, indicating it is directed at a witness or person of interest who may possess evidence.

The document references potential violations of federal statutes 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), and 1519 (destruction of evidence), suggesting the investigation's focus areas.
